main event: A circular luminous object was observed in Montevideo, Minnesota on November 20, 1962, moving rapidly across the sky and losing sight after a few seconds.
interesting points: The object rose to about 30 degrees elevation in the northwest and moved southeast, The witness reported no sound from the object, The witness estimated the object's speed at 75 miles per hour, The sighting occurred under a full moon on a clear night, and the witness believed it could have been a flying saucer.
witness description: A 44-year-old male farmer, higher school graduate, interested in nature, previously saw weather balloons and flares.
